text: Has anyone been able to successfully create a multi-select option for custom modules (i.e. replicate the multi-select as seen in hubDB) without going crazy with workarounds?
that seems to be the only real way to do it.
huh. that's an idea. Good thought.
I wonder why it doesn't exist as an option for a custom field
I do the same, or if it isn't too strict I'll parse comma separated values from a text field

<@UDFTHC6PK>, <@U38EZFVFE> - how do you cope with form's fields generated based on HubDB? I've been told that unless field's values are defined (upon form's creation), form won't be processed (as values get validated).

I've been working on something similar, with multi-select generated on HubDB table's contents.
Hm. I can't say that I've dabbled too much in that area. My need for a multi-select in this instance is based on needs on the content editor side and unrelated to forms. <@U38EZFVFE> any thoughts?

Hey all, I’m looking to display/filter a certain amount of words/characters in a module, e.g:

```<p class="new-paragraph">
  {{ content.post_list_content|safe|striptags }}
</p>```
Outputs:
```Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit, sed do eiusmod tempor incididunt ut labore et dolore```
But I’m looking for:
```Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit```
